message.body: Hello!
Are you available to text?
Yes I'm available. How are you
Good, how are you doing?
Where are you texting from?
I'm going well thank you for asking. I'm testing from Michigan, student at UofM how about you?
I'm in the Philadelphia area. Student at west Chester u. What do you study?
Senior studying political science and global health. Hbu
Had a pre midlife crisis / epiphany and went back to school for nursing.
Wow that's amazing that you had the courage and strength to go through school again!
How is The nursing program?
Haha, it's def an annoyance to do it oer again, but worth it in the end. It's fine, how is your program?
What were you doing before you decided to go back to school? My program is just the stepping stone to 50 more year of schooling hahaha I still have to go
through masters in public health an md and a phd on infectious disease.
But my program now is amazing. It covers aspects of third world public health infectious diseases the history of disease epidemics And hiv/aids. I love it!
Ok see you
That's sounds really amazing!
Sorry I'm a tad distracted was at a garden store buying a fig tree
I grew up in Sudan before coming here, so I've seen what its like to be in the other end of all this. Its what drives my passion :)
Lol take your time!
Okay back. So Sudan is an interesting place to have grown up. I have a friend from Sudan, and have seen some if his photos. You must have an interestingperspective on things
We kid with the friend because he comes home with malaria almost every time he comes back from visiting home
he shrugs off malaria as if its no big deal. very strange for us as American born
Also to answer your question I was a researcher in a nonprofit taste and smell research co.
And also my program is only phase 1 as well. I will have to get masters next ad then some post masters work. It is switching to a doctoral program in 2015 also so I need to get I. Under the wire.
Lol yes my family is sudanese I was born here but lived in Sudan until I was in first grade then we came here and we go back to visit every year. But yes
malaria is like the common cold there, its really no big deal, you get it at least once a month lol
Haha, amazing because here it is unheard of, it just SOUNDS really scary
What is Sudanese cuisine like?
A lot of the Sudanese cuisine is similar to lots of Arab cuisine because of the Arab influence in the region throughout history. but it is amazing! Lol w
e use a lot of oils and thick sauces, bad for your cholesterol but amazing. I'm actually grocery shopping for things now, lol making stuffed bell pepper
Yummy! I'm on break from school until Tuesday so I have some time to cook this weekend maybe ill google a Sudanese recipe or two!
Eating Indian food for breakfast right now... Love the rich spicy sauces :)
So what type of establishment or organization will you probably end up working in?
Yes! I do that all the time lol Indian food is amazing! I actually learned to cook a bunch of dishes, I learned how to make Indian samosas biryani and a
bunch of dishes from one of my roommates a few years back.
My friend's joke:Q- you know what they call Indian food in India? A- food.
I want to hopefully work with the WHO. One of my professors was the dean at the school of public health and he introduced me to the former director of th
e WHO which was amazing beyond words and that has been my dream job for ages now so all this schooling and real world practice is to get me there.
Lol
Yay! Go you! I really hope it works out, it seems like it will since you clearly have a passion for your work
Thank you! So what made you decide to go into the nursing program? Are you interested in a research career or do you want to work in a hospital setting o
r teaching.
Actually I am going back for nurse midwifery. There are huge problems with women's healthcare in this country that I would like to address. Rural and und
erserved populations are my target cliets. After a career on call, I would like to get my phd in nursing Ed. And "retire" into teaching.
That sounds amazing!
How long do you have to go before you complete your program?

I will be done part one in December. It was a fat program because it is my second bachelors. 18 months total. Then on to grad school 2-3 years and the midwifery cert. another 6 months. In total, I should be done in about five years.
*fast, not fat
